1�I'm Kupi?`pi!
1�You are to bring-wing me with you on your adventures. Vana'diel hath no fury like a secretary scorned!

1�That is all.
1�Now skedaddle!
1�When visiting the upper floors of the tower, you must be on your be?`st behavior. Especially around the head lady-in-waiting, Zubaba!

1�But doing this helps maintain peace in Windurst, so I ask you kindly to shut your eyes to any doubts you have concerning this mission. Now take this item to the treasure chamber in Giddeus and hurry back...in one piece!

l!�I must apologize, Star Sibyl. We have failed in our duty to keep intruders from your chambers...
1�I will pursue the creature at once. The rest of the Sibyl Guards will be placed under Ajido-Marujido's command.
1�Star Sibyl...Are you sure of this!?
1�You've received the mission briefing?
1�The situation has become volatile. The Yagudo are screaming that Windurst has broken one of the clauses of the peace treaty.
1�There is a passage in the treaty that states the central magic tower in West Sarutabaruta shall not be reactivated without the prior agreement of both parties.
1�Apparently it did not escape the beady eyes of the Yagudo when Ajido-Marujido awoke the tower using the Mana Orbs.
1�Now they're demanding we give them control of the Horutoto Ruins to make amends for our break in faith.
1�It's obvious those feathered devils want to establish a base rrright under Windurst's nose, but it'll be a cold day in Kazham before I ever let something like that happen...
1�......In any event, the rescue of the Star Sibyl comes first and foremost. Let us go and meet with Ajido-Marujido.
1�Apururu!?If you're here, then you must have...
1�Raise your head, Apururu. This is not your fault.
1�I was the one who took the Star Sibyl down to the Full Moon Fountain while unknown terrors stalked the shadows. I accept full responsibility.
1�What are you saying!?

4�...You made it back in time.

1�It was your resolution that brought a new beginning for a Windurst that had lost its future.

1�It's time I should be going as well. Don't forget to visit the Star Sibyl before you leave.
1�Before taking her rest, she mentioned she wanted to talk with you.
1�Well,  .Until the day we once again fight side by side, may the fire in your eyes never fade...

a!�Are you aware of a recently developed magical rrregimen known as the Trust initiative?

1�Wait! You'll be wasting your time. Nobody can stop that thing.
1�Star Sibyl, the magic the creature was using was no ordinary spellcraft. That power was of the Stars and the Moon. The same power that pulses through the Horutoto Ruins and fills the Mana Orbs...
1�It was the magic of Fenrir, the Great Beast that resided in the Full Moon Fountain. You felt it, didn't you?
1�Star Sibyl, I have read the Book of the Gods. I know all aboutaru the beginning of Windurst and the deeds of the first Star Sibyl.
1�You mustaru tell us. What happened at the Full Moon Fountain twenty years ago?
1�...But, Star Sibyl--the future lives on. As Fenrir told you, the path still lies before us...
1�Neither peace nor destruction is certain. We mustaru seize the light with our own hands...!
1�Star Sibyl, I ask you for permission to enter the Animastery of Karaha-Baruha.
1�He and I are of the same mind. All I wantaru is to save Windurst. I need the knowledge that Karaha-Baruha uncovered...

1�...The research left here was extremely thorough. A perfectaru theory that surpassed all other systems of magic to stand at the pinnacle of achievement.

1�However, that spirit was too vast for any one person's body to contain, the energy too intense. Fenrir was dragged into the abyss of death along with Karaha-Baruha.
1�And now the deceased have returned...The ??bearer of darkness?? is an incarnation that contains the spirit of both Karaha-Baruha, and the Great Beast.
1�Of that, we can'taru be certain. When Joker's wish is fulfilled and the bearer of darkness returns to the Full Moon Fountain, there is no telling what will happen.
1�However, to keep the Star Sibyl from harm, we mustaru do as Joker requests.

1�This method entails using the song of the ancient Kuluu that is mentioned in the Book of the Gods. The Kuluu had apparentaruly forged a pact with the avatars.
1�The three verses of the song are kept in three separate ruins...
1� , we need you to travel to Ro'Maeve, the Chamber of Oracles, and the Temple of Uggalepih to collect those verses.
1�I don'taru know what form they will take, but they should at leastaru be recognizable as a legacy left for succeeding generations.
1�Semih Lafihna, go to Chieftainness Perih Vashai and explain the situation.
1�If something should happen to the Star Sibyl, the Tarutaru will completaruly lose their marbles, not to mention their will to fight.
1�And you can bet the Yagudo will choose that exactaru moment to attack. Windurst will be annihilated before you can spit outaru ??deranged, drooling dhalmels??...
1�The Mithra must be ready to take the front line in such a battle. Your strength and prowess will be sorely needed, Semih Lafihna.
1�And lastaruly...Apururu, we were talking about the possibility of disabling the Cardians. Can it really be done?
1�A sliver-wiver of time in which to rescue the Star Sibyl...
1�But where do we find such a source of power? And will you be capable of wielding it?
1�Hrmph. Taught a few black arts by a certain Tarutaru is more like it.
1�Don't go hurting yourself, Apururu.
1�  is no ordinary adventurer, Semih Lafihna.
1�We've been waiting for you. Actually, we were slightaruly worried you wouldn't be able to gather all the verses before the show started.
1�While you've been out hop-popping all over the place, we've had a message from the King of the Yagudo announcing the imminentaru abolishment of the peace treaty.
1�And to Joker's lifespan as well, I should imagine...
1�A doll only lives a certain amountaru of time corresponding to the amountaru of magic its creator poured into it during creation.
1�I asked the children at the port about the date of Joker's resurrection. I did some calculations...
1�And from what the results tell me, it would seem that Joker's clock will soon tick its last tock. Joker is probably also well aware of his predicamentaru.
1�The Cardians and the Yagudo have some kind of deal going on. You really should have noticed it by now.
1�Think about the incidentaru where the talisman was stolen from the Chamber of Light. That room can only be opened by myself, a Cardian, or a representative of Heavens Tower.
1�To top it off, this treaty business comes at the worstaru possible time for us.
1�Either they know that the Star Sibyl is missing, or that Windurst is particularly vulnerable right now...
1�No, no. Think about it. If that was the case they wouldn'taru have given us a deadline. The Yagudo are simply waiting for Joker to expire.
1�This is justaru speculation on my part, but I would say relations between the Yagudo and the Cardians wentaru decidedly downhill after Joker took up the Cardian crown.
1�It's entirely possible that he is neither friend nor foe.
1�Appearing at night, and fading with the day... Justaru like the will of the Great Beast...
1�Hrm. With three professors helping you, there's little chance of it not working. It's the chance that they were a little over-enthusiastic that worries me...
1�Well, we've done everything that we can.
1�There's little pointaru to sitting around imagining what's going to happen. Only time will tell.
1�The momentaru has come!To the Full Moon Fountain!
1�The Star Sibyl is resting.The ceremony at the Full Moon Fountain has drained her. It will probably be some time until she recovers.
1�Along with Joker, all of the Cardians that were in that place have returned to nothing more than ordinary puppets.
1�The power of the Stars and the Moon that was stored in their Mana Orbs, the small amountaru of that same energy left in the fountain, and the magic of the Star Sibyl's Diza Star...
1�All of it was consumed to revive the Great Beast, Fenrir.
1�That is the Moon Reading...The power to grantaru wishes.
1�It may take some time until Fenrir is back to his legendary strength, however...
1�Windurst has regained the protection of the Stars and the Moon. Our fair land will once again be visitarued by serene, twinkling evenings and peaceful dreams.
1�Semih Lafihna. You're back. I bet those Yagudo were screeching for blood.
1�They're a careful bunch, that's for sure. Now that the Ace Cardians are gone, we can assume they'll hold back on abolishing the peace treaty as well.
1�But you know they won'taru give up on the ruins that easily.
1�She has found us a new guiding star.
1�It's strange, but I feel like I've been freed as well... Freed from the spell Karaha-Baruha had over me.
1�It was almostaru as if I was having my strings pulled by the research left by the great genius...
1�My theory is that he had predictarued a talented mage like myself would come to prominence after his death.
1�What's with you, Apururu? You've got a smartaru mouth on you today.
1�Things never would've gotten this bad if you wishy-washy slowpokes at the Manustery had done something about the rogue Cardians earlier.
1�Ah, finally. Without that ring, I can'taru get into the Minister's Chambers. Not being able to get into my own room is going to do wonders for my reputation as a formidable spell-slinger!
1�If you need any more work, come on over to the Orastery. We have the budgetaru to employ one or two people for experimental purposes.
1�There are a few new spells I learned from the Book of the Gods that I've been dying to try. I guarantee it'll be a fascinataruing experience.
1�Well, well, well! I never thought I'd see such a lack of confidence from a member of the mighty d'Oraguille family!
1�Really?Well, that's your nation. Windurst doesn't face such problems.

1�Our Mithran Mercenaries enjoy being sent to far-off places. It gives them the opportunity to run and jump and hunt and roll around in the mud--whatever those feminine felines like to do in their free time.
1�Maybe instead of buffing up your soldiers' muscles all day, you should try training their minds...like we do. And that's my two gil!
1�Well, we...
1�Shantotto!
1�Shantotto!?
1�The representatives here in Heavens Tower won't listen to me, but I'm certain that most of the weapons and food that are offered are just sold to other beastmen around Vana'diel.
1�There's something else?
1�You say my father told you to seek me out?
1�I've been trying to figure out as much as I can about the strange portals that link our Vana'diel to another dimension.
1�But we've got other problems to deal with first. Let's worry about it once we've finished our current mission.
1�I'll meet you at the Crag of Mea in Tahrongi Canyon once we've got that burden off our shoulders. Or we could catch up at Dem or Holla, if that's preferable to you.
1�Remember to see the missions posed to you by your home nation to completion first, though.
1�We can issue you a Gold World Pass, which bestows special benefits and can be used to invite friends to play in the same world as you are in now. How may we help you today?
